title: Bulgaria: Young Economists Compete in First National Financial Innovation Camp
summary: Sofia - Seventy Bulgarian students from schools throughout the country demonstrated their economic knowledge and skills at the first national financial literacy schools competition, the Financial Innovation Camp. The winning team came up with a mobile application solution that combined the functionalities of social networks and a financial thesaurus. Awards and medals were presented by Mr. Stefan Felstein, Citi Country Officer for Bulgaria, and Mrs. Milena Stoycheva, CEO of Junior Achievement Bulgaria.
tag-1: Bulgaria: Young Economists Compete in First National Financial Innovation Camp
tag-2: Sofia – Seventy Bulgarian students from schools throughout the country demonstrated their economic knowledge and skills at the first national financial literacy schools competition, the Financial Innovation Camp. The winning team came up with a mobile application solution that combined the functionalities of social networks and a financial thesaurus. Awards and medals were presented by Mr. Stefan Felstein, Citi Country Officer for Bulgaria, and Mrs. Milena Stoycheva, CEO of Junior Achievement Bulgaria.
tag-3: The Financial Innovation Camp is the highlight event of the Financial Literacy and Bank Management program for secondary school students aged 16 - 18, supported by Junior Achievement Bulgaria and Citibank Bulgaria. Program participants qualified for the camp by competing against other teams within the environment of an online banking simulation, analyzing case studies and making business decisions as managers.
tag-4: At the Financial Innovation Camp, the teams were given a case study with the task of either designing a new and innovative financial product or service or coming up with an innovative twist to an existing one from a consumer point of view. Ten teams spent more than five hours working on their ideas. Apart from their newly acquired knowledge and skills, the teams could rely on the assistance of the internet and the advice of Citi employees who had volunteered as the business consultants. At the end of the competition, the teams presented their solutions to the panel of judges.
tag-5: "I am very happy to see that our long-term partnership with Citibank Bulgaria has evolved and expanded to the innovation camp format. Within the framework of our program, the future economists and financiers of Bulgaria will be able to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary for their future career development." said Milena Stoycheva, CEO of JA Bulgaria at the Award Ceremony.
tag-6: The Financial Literacy and Bank Management Program gives young people the opportunity to learn about real business conditions, best business practices, sound business economic models and instruments applied in the real business and finance industry. The program culminates in the best student teams competing at the Financial Innovation Camp.

tag-10: Junior Achievement Junior Achievement is the world's largest organization dedicated to inspiring and preparing young people to succeed in a global economy. Through a dedicated volunteer network, Junior Achievement provides in-school and after-school programs for students which focus on three key content areas: work readiness, entrepreneurship, and financial literacy. Today, 138 individual area operations reach more than four million students in the United States, with an additional 4.3 million students served by operations in 118 other countries worldwide.
